greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of proper divisors of n that are odious (A000069).
comment: If n is odd and k >= 1, then a(2^k*n) = (k+1)*n+k if n is in A000069 and (k+1)*n if n is not in A000069. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 03 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16385
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
example: For n = 55 whose proper divisors are 1, 5 and 11 (in binary "1", "101" and "1011"), only 1 and 11 have an odd number of 1's in their binary representations, thus a(55) = 2.
maple: f:= proc(n) nops(select(t -> convert(convert(t,base,2),`+`)::odd, numtheory:-divisors(n) minus {n})) end proc:
mathematica: Table[DivisorSum[n, 1 &, And[OddQ@ DigitCount[#, 2, 1], # < n] &], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 03 2017 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2017
